                    ### Question
                    Which of the following is the best-known metabolic function of the lung

                    ### Options
                    opa. Inactivation of serotonin
opb. Conversion of angiotensin–I to angiotensin–II
opc. Inactivation of bradykinin
opd. Metabolism of basic drugs by cytochrome P–450 system

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
The primary metabolic function of the lungs is the conversion of angiotensin-I to angiotensin-II, facilitated by the angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) in the endothelial cells. This function is central to the renin-angiotensin system, regulating blood pressure and fluid balance. Other functions such as inactivation of serotonin and bradykinin, and metabolism of basic drugs by cytochrome P-450, occur in the lungs but are less prominent and significant compared to angiotensin conversion.
